intro: Erysimum siculum, commonly known as the Sicilian wallflower, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces bright yellow or orange flowers in early spring. The plant has linear, gray-green leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological value.
